summary: Federal employees can invest in the Thrift Savings Plan, the nation's largest retirement plan. In 2020, the agency that runs the plan contracted with a company to modernize its recordkeeping system, website, and mobile app. The new system launched in 2022, triggering a wave of complaints. The agency and contractor have improved the system, but there's more to do. For example, some benefit payments involving...
title: Thrift Savings Plan: Investment Board Needs to Greatly Improve Acquisition Management and Contractor Oversight
